alert.note: Alert for Banner (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 26 at 9:20PM CDT until June 26 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT FOR WEST CENTRAL CHEYENNE...EASTERN KIMBALL AND SOUTHEASTERN BANNER COUNTIES... At 820 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Harrisburg to 9 miles north of Kimball to near Kimball Airport, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 818 PM, tennis ball sized hail was reported 3 miles southeast of Kimball. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Kimball, Dix, Harrisburg and Kimball Airport. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 17 and 36. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: These storms are producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
